title: Questionable 14 day suspension
body:
G'day gents, very new to the game, and am happy to say I'll never be playing again after this. I dropped 20 dollars on the spot because I decided I wanted to fast level to 30 to get into ranked quicker, so I could play with my irl mates. That was money wasted. Here's why. 

Recently, in maybe my 12th game of league of legends, I encountered an 18 year old with a good taste in "dark humour". I wish I had access to what he said during his chat logs of the game, but they unfortunately belong to whoever at riot controls such things. This Azir was very upset at all of us right from the get go, he was dying a hell of a lot and being genuinely uncooperative. Quote "I'm not doing anything to help you c*nts", etc. Que me coming into the chat, I started berating him (which probably wasn't the smartest, but hindsight is always 20/20). This was all just internet haha as far as I'm concerned, until he said "I hope you all get cancer." Now I've had my father pass from cancer maybe two years ago, so I thought this would be a good opportunity to remind this player of his humanity. I stated my experience ingame, not really sure what I was expecting as a response. I knew deep down that because it was the internet it could go both ways, but in any case I decided at the time it was the best course of action. I was wrong. He said "Yeah, he probably deserved it." I was pretty offended, but not quite so offended as when players on the OPPOSING team were telling me to get over it, how it was simply a case of "Dark humour" and that I was "Too immature" to understand. 

However, this isn't even what really made me MAD. What made me angry, was that I received a 14 day suspension (Hence losing my 7 day xp boost that I paid MONEY for in the process) due to my replies. They weren't the kindest, but I'll drop a copy paste of my chatlogs for the suspension and you guys can decide for yourself whether or not you would have said or done the same things in my shoes. I do not think what I said ingame was worthy of a 14 day suspension, but thats just my two cents, maybe I'm biased. What do you guys think? Here's the chat logs (CHAT LOGS: Game 1

replies.body:
Ok so HeartVine addressed most of it but I think there's some extra context I can give you.

First of all, just because you got punished, doesn't mean they didn't. If they were using the sort of language you describe then I can almost guarantee that they were escalated straight to a 14 day suspension.

Second, while there are certain things in you log that could technically be considered hate speech (discrimination by age and sexual status) I imagine it was the cancer references that probably got you escalated. It sounds like this was your first punishment so I'm going to assume that moving forward, but if you've had chat restrictions in the past a 14 day would be the natural progression of that and won't be revoked or reduced. 

Given that in context you were simply quoting what the other guy said, that's obviously a false escalation. Don't misunderstand, this chat log is 100% worthy of punishment, but assuming no priors or edits it would most likely net you a chat restriction, not a 14 day suspension, though this is at the discretion of support staff. This is where contacting support comes in. 
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Third, you are not given the chat logs of others in the game becuase the point of these punishments is for you to reflect on your behaviour, not deflect or justify it with theirs. I am in no way suggesting that what they did was ok, only that taking things beyond defending yourself and into abuse loses you the high road, and you are held responsible for your actions same as they are. You already know what they said that made you respond that way, the purpose of having your chat logs is for you to reflect on *your* behaviour.

Lastly, the summoner names were removed from your post essentially to prevent witch hunting. When it comes to these cases on boards, we don't get the full context, and never will, so to prevent with hunts or negative perceptions that may or may not be deserved, we have a no naming and shaming (officially No Reporting Other Players) rule here on boards.
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/BjArMH2B-boards-universal-rules

If you have any questions regarding the support process or anything else, just reply to this comment and I'll help you as soon as I can :)

Stupid. Azir's behavior was dark and unacceptable. Dark cancer jokes intending to insult another player (like azir to this guy's deceased father) should be dealt with accordingly. That being an instantaneous perma-ban. You're only delaying the inevitable when you let this guy stay in the community.

Everyone deserves a chance to reform; if they've blown that chance, then sayonara. Hopefully that player gets a 2-week ban, but I think immediate permaban for chat is harsh, even in severe circumstances.

Honestly, I'm not impressed with the way you acted, *however* this seems like it's not worthy of a 14-day suspension, *in and of itself*. With that in mind, if you haven't received the previous punishments (10-game and 25-game chat restrictions) I'd recommend submitting a ticket via [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to appeal the ban (I'd recommend selecting "I have a question about a suspension or restriction on my account"). It's possible that the system identified certain terms/phrases and didn't properly catch onto the context of them, which can happen on the rare occasion (no system is perfect, after all), so that may be a contributing factor if this is indeed a case of escalation. On the other hand, if you have previously received both the chat restriction punishments, an appeal will more than likely fall flat on it's face and amount to nothing.

You're just going to get told you should have muted and reported at the end of the game. You're not allowed to use the chat in League of Legends anymore.
